decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with key creatures like Atraxa and then reanimating them using cards like Goryo's Vengeance. It also includes control elements like Force of Negation and removal spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending to protect the combo pieces. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Teferi, Time Raveler provide card advantage and disruption. Quantum Riddler and Psychic Frog are used for their ability to mill the opponent or control what they draw. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells. Cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide early pressure, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory offer additional support and damage. Seasoned Pyromancer helps with card advantage and token generation, while cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment provide additional reach and removal. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Static Prison and Blood Moon to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan with a mix of Plains, Mountains, and fetch lands.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and efficiently to be able to cast Primeval Titan and combo off with Amulet of Vigor, allowing for explosive plays with lands like Urza's Saga and Simic Growth Chamber. The deck aims to find ways to search for key pieces like Titan and lands with cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Summoner's Pact, leading to powerful board states where the opponent is overwhelmed by massive threats and combos. The deck's strategy relies on carefully managing resources and utilizing land synergies to overwhelm opponents quickly.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It combines control elements with efficient removal spells and powerful creatures to create a taxing and aggressive strategy. The key idea is to control the board, limit the opponent's options, and close out the game quickly with evasive threats. Additionally, the deck includes some flicker effects to generate value from enters-the-battlefield abilities and protect key creatures. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while presenting a clock that they must answer.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively with a combination of creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It utilizes a mix of efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, alongside powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial. The Leyline cards help to control the board and protect the player's creatures. The key strategy is to maintain pressure on the opponent while keeping control of the battlefield, using a combination of creatures, spells, and enchantments to secure victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride to deal damage to the opponent. It also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer for extra damage and card advantage. The deck utilizes cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment for removal and control. The inclusion of cards like Blood Moon disrupts the opponent's mana base, while Arena of Glory provides additional buffs to your creatures. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and aggressive plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Broodscale Bloodchief combo with cards like Writhing Chrysalis and Glaring Fleshraker to create powerful board states and overwhelm opponents. It also utilizes various support cards like Blade of the Bloodchief and Kozilek's Command to enhance the combo's effectiveness. The deck's mana base includes lands like Urza's Saga and Eldrazi Temple to ramp up quickly and cast high-cost cards like Emrakul, the Promised End. With a mix of control elements and powerful creatures, the deck aims to quickly establish dominance and outpace the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource to consistently bring back powerful creatures like Prized Amalgam and Silversmote Ghoul. Cards like Golgari Thug and Stinkweed Imp help fill up the graveyard quickly, while Cathartic Reunion and Faithless Looting provide card draw and graveyard filling. Creeping Chill acts as both a source of damage and life gain. The deck aims to quickly fill up the graveyard, trigger creatures to come back, and overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature plays, using efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu to put pressure on the opponent. It also utilizes powerful enchantments like Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding to control the board and protect its creatures. The inclusion of Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial provide removal and counterspell options to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also has a small amount of land destruction and a splash of white for additional versatility. Overall, the key concept is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures such as Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. Cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu provide additional pressure and card advantage. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Consign to Memory to deal with opposing threats. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help support the deck's multicolor strategy, while Arena of Glory provides additional combat advantages. Overall, the deck aims to establish an early board presence and pressure the opponent into submission.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures and efficient burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing a mix of creatures with varying abilities and powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent and finish the game quickly. The inclusion of Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding helps to protect your creatures and maintain board control. The deck also includes mana fixing lands to ensure consistent access to all colors needed for spells and creatures in the deck.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and efficiently using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to accelerate into big threats like Primeval Titan. The deck utilizes lands like Urza's Saga and Crumbling Vestige to generate additional mana and gain advantages. The combo aspect comes into play with cards like Scapeshift and Lotus Field, allowing the player to search for specific lands and set up powerful board states. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast mana production and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with powerful abilities to create a synergistic combo that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. By maximizing the potential of cards like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker, along with support from equipment like Blade of the Bloodchief, the deck aims to generate massive amounts of damage in a short amount of time. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Kozilek's Command and Ancient Stirrings helps ensure consistency in setting up the combo pieces. With strong mana acceleration provided by Urza's Saga and Eldrazi Temple, the deck can rapidly deploy its threats and quickly close out games.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with key creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, then using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to bring them back onto the battlefield for a quick win. It also includes disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect the combo and control the board. The deck aims to outpace and overwhelm the opponent with powerful reanimation plays while using a mixture of control and combo elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Lotus Bloom, while also utilizing disruptive counterspells like Disrupting Shoal and Flare of Denial to protect the combo pieces. It avoids relying on traditional lands by utilizing alternative mana sources like Hydroelectric Specimen and Tameshi, Reality Architect. The deck also includes card draw and tutor effects like Waterlogged Teachings and Whir of Invention to ensure consistency in finding the combo pieces. The strategy is to quickly assemble the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a board of artifact creatures and utilizing artifact synergies to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage through efficient draw spells. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats while also having access to versatile removal options and disruption tools to control the tempo of the game. By leveraging artifacts and generating value from them, the deck capitalizes on its synergies to create a strong, resilient board presence that can quickly close out games.
